item.title: Building a Tech Industry in Syria From Scratch

item.title: Turkey arrests dozens over online posts after Erdogan rival detained
item.description: Some 37 people have been arrested for "provocative" social media posts, the interior ministry says.

item.title: Hamas fires rockets at Tel Aviv as Israel renews Gaza ground campaign
item.description: It comes after Israel resumes its bombing campaign and ground operations in Gaza.

item.title: Trump signs executive order to begin dismantling Department of Education
item.description: President Trump has taken aim at the Department of Education, but shutting down the department entirely would require an act of Congress.

item.description: President Trump expected to sign executive order dismantling Education Department; Finland ranked happiest country in the world.

item.title: Fingerprints identify Paraguayan woman seven years after death
item.description: Ainoha Izaga Ibieta Lima, 33, was found dead in a poultry shed attached to a farmhouse in Spain's Girona province in 2018.

item.title: What does the US education department do - and can Trump dismantle it?
item.description: The US president is expected to order a shutdown of the department, which he has already cut back.

item.title: HELOC rates fall to a new two-year low: What to know now
item.description: HELOC interest rates continued to fall this week, giving prospective borrowers a few timely items to think about.
